name: Suitable Alternative Accommodation Available
short_description: Suitable alternative accommodation is available for tenant

criteria: Reasonably suitable to needs of tenant and family
Similar location (proximity to work, schools, family)
Security of tenure (assured or secure tenancy preferred)

availability.timing: Available at time tenant must give up possession
availability.certificate: Can be certified by local authority

notice_period.court_proceedings: Can be started after notice expires

evidence_required: Details of alternative accommodation (address, size, rent)
Evidence of availability (tenancy offer, landlord letter)
Comparison showing suitability (room sizes, location, facilities)
Evidence accommodation will be available when needed

high_probability: Similar or better quality and size
Tenant has no special needs that cannot be met
medium_probability: Accommodation suitable but tenant disputes this
low_probability: Tenant has special needs not met

red_flags: Tenant has disabilities and accommodation unsuitable
Children would need to change schools
No local authority certificate and suitability disputed
notes: Ground 9 is DISCRETIONARY and rarely used due to difficulty proving suitability. Courts scrutinize alternative accommodation carefully. Local authority certificate is powerful evidence but not conclusive. Often combined with other grounds.
case_law: Redspring v Francis [1973] - Accommodation must be suitable to needs of tenant and family
Siddiqui v Rashid [1980] - Suitability judged at date of hearing
Hill v Rochard [1983] - Proximity to work and family is relevant
Nessa v Basildon DC [2015] - Tenant's special needs must be considered
court_considerations: Is the alternative accommodation genuinely available?
Is it suitable for the tenant and their family's needs?
What security of tenure is offered?
How does location compare (work, schools, support networks)?
Are there any special needs to consider?
Is it reasonable to grant possession in all circumstances?

local_authority_certificate.process: Landlord applies to local authority housing department
local_authority_certificate.timeline: Can take several weeks to obtain
local_authority_certificate.note: Not conclusive - court can still find unsuitable
